title: Google Chrome Performance
description: Fix Chrome slowness, high memory usage, and unresponsive pages.

steps.title: Hard Reload Page
steps.instruction: Press Ctrl + F5 (or Cmd + Shift + R on Mac). This bypasses the cache and reloads all assets from the server.

steps.title: Clear Browser Cache
steps.instruction: Go to Chrome Settings (3 dots) → Clear Browsing Data → Select 'Cached images and files' → Clear data.

steps.title: Disable Unused Extensions
steps.instruction: Type 'chrome://extensions' in the address bar. Disable any extensions you don't use daily; they can slow down every page.

steps.title: Use Chrome Task Manager
steps.instruction: Press Shift + Esc while in Chrome. Identify which specific tab or extension is consuming the most RAM/CPU and end it.

steps.title: Reset Chrome Settings
steps.instruction: Settings → Reset settings → Restore settings to their original defaults. This fixes deep misconfigurations.
